description: Computer software is said to have Internal Documentation if the notes on how and why various parts of code operate is included within the source code as comments. It is often combined with meaningful variable names with the intention of providing potential future programmers a means of understanding the workings of the code.
name: Internal Documentation

value: Computer software is said to have Internal Documentation if the notes on how and why various parts of code operate is included within the source code as comments.
